meanings.definition: A regulatory substance produced in an organism and transported in tissue fluids such as blood or sap to stimulate specific cells or tissues into action.
meanings.sent1: The hormone signaled the cells to grow.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes prescribe hormones to help with certain health conditions.
meanings.sent3: The hormone was like a messenger delivering important news to the cells.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm acted like a hormone, spreading quickly among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The hormone was like a conductor orchestrating the actions of the cells.

meanings.definition: A synthetic substance with a similar effect.
meanings.sent1: Athletes should be cautious when using synthetic hormones.
meanings.sent2: Some athletes use hormones to enhance their performance.
meanings.sent3: The synthetic hormone was like a superhero power-up for the body.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the synthetic hormone represented a shortcut to success.
meanings.sent5: The synthetic hormone worked like a magic potion, boosting strength and speed.
